abstract: General Electric said Monday that it would pay $4.8 billion for Smiths Aerospace, the cockpit electronics arm of the London conglomerate Smiths Group. The two companies said they would pool their technologies for detecting bombs, chemicals and other dangerous items into a joint venture, Smiths GE Detection.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said Monday that it would pay $4.8 billion for Smiths Aerospace, the cockpit electronics arm of the London conglomerate Smiths Group. The two companies said they would pool their technologies for detecting bombs, chemicals and other dangerous items into a joint venture, Smiths GE Detection.

headline.main: G.E. Takes Off with a British Aerospace Company
